item.description: Contents Overview Slides Preliminary Survey Overview An introduction to the course and the tools we use in microeconomics. Slides Lecture Slides Preliminary Survey Please take the preliminary survey on your math background. This will help us all have a productive course together.

item.title: 1.3 Optimization and the Budget Constraint - Class Notes
item.description: Contents Overview Slides Practice Problems Math Survey Math Review Overview We begin with an overview of constrained optimization models and our first application, how individuals choose. Our primary focus will be people as consumers - how do they choose to spend their money and how do those choices change? While we will focus extensively on consumers making purchasing choices, do not think this is the only use of this type of model!

item.title: Class 2: Scarcity, Choice, and Cost
item.description: Contents Overview Slides Survey Overview Before we jump into our optimization models to descibe and predict (changes in) individual choices and behavior, we cover the basic principles of choice and action in a world of scarcity. This is what motivates economics. Slides Lecture Slides Survey
